org.jscsi.initiator.connection.state

Interface IState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CapacityRequestState, CapacityResponseState, GetConnectionsRequestState, LoginRequestState, LoginResponseState, LogoutRequestState, LogoutResponseState, ReadRequestState, ReadResponseState, SNACKRequestState, WriteFirstBurstState, WriteRequestState, WriteSecondBurstState, WriteSecondResponseState

    public interface IState

    IState

    Each inherited state must implement this interface.

    Author:
    Volker Wildi

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute()
      This method is always invoked, when a request message must be send or response message must be received and then parsed.
      Exception isCorrect(org.jscsi.parser.ProtocolDataUnit protocolDataUnit)
      This method checks the correctness of the given ProtocolDataUnit instance within the current state of a connection.
      boolean nextStateFollowing()
      This method shows if another state is following this one.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute()
             throws org.jscsi.exception.InternetSCSIException
        This method is always invoked, when a request message must be send or response message must be received and then parsed.
        Throws:
        org.jscsi.exception.InternetSCSIException - if any violation of the iSCSI Standard (RfC3720) has emerged.

      • nextStateFollowing

        boolean nextStateFollowing()
        This method shows if another state is following this one.
        Returns:
        true, if another state must follow this state. Else an final state is reached.

      • isCorrect

        Exception isCorrect(org.jscsi.parser.ProtocolDataUnit protocolDataUnit)
        This method checks the correctness of the given ProtocolDataUnit instance within the current state of a connection.
        Parameters:
        protocolDataUnit - The ProtocolDataUnit instance to check.
        Returns:
        Exception if any problem occured with the PDU, null otherwise.
